verses.verse: (Praise the Judge of the World) A Psalm. (Ex 15.6; Ps 33.3; Isa 52.10) O sing to the LORD a new song, for he has done marvelous things. His right hand and his holy arm have gotten him victory.
(Rom 3.25) The LORD has made known his victory; he has revealed his vindication in the sight of the nations.
(Isa 49.6; Lk 1.54) He has remembered his steadfast love and faithfulness to the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the victory of our God.
(Ps 100.1) Make a joyful noise to the LORD, all the earth; break forth into joyous song and sing praises.
Sing praises to the LORD with the lyre, with the lyre and the sound of melody.
(Num 10.10) With trumpets and the sound of the horn make a joyful noise before the King, the LORD.
(Ps 24.1; 96.11) Let the sea roar and all that fills it, the world and those who live in it.
(Ps 65.12; 93.3) Let the floods clap their hands; let the hills sing together for joy
(Ps 96.10, 13) at the presence of the LORD, for he is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with equity.
